history.content: I took 161 with him a year ago. He is very passionate about computer security. He has lots of stories to tell about the topic. Some say his teaching/speech style is too exaggerated, but I personally really love it. His digressions/stories and passion in the field really captures my attention in class, and it's one of the few lectures I don't fall asleep in.

children.subject: +1 Nick Weaver is eccentric, but super into security. You may find his eccentricity annoying, but it doesn't detract from the fact he is an amazing instructor.

As one of his 61C TAs, he's a passionate guy who isn't afraid to have a little fun. He's really into the subject matter of the stuff he teaches and will gladly answer your questions if they get deeper into the course content.

history.content:
Has anyone taken CS161 with Nicholas Weaver? How is his teaching style?

If not 161, what about in 61C?

Thanks!
